page.title: 10A Typical Farm
page.content: We looked at each of the questionaires we had received from the farmers in our village and discussed what would be a typical farm.We then chose a farm which we thought was the closest to the typical farm. This has{320 acres of land and needs{3 regular and some {seasonal workers}to look after it. Like many of the farms in the area the land is used for both{grazing}and cultivated{crops}and is partly owned by the farmer and the local landowner. {Beef cattle}are kept until they are 2 years old, when they are sold for slaughter. Numbers vary from 120 to 160 head. A few{ewes}are also kept, about 6 to 10 in number. The main {crops}grown are the cereal crops: wheat, oats and barley covering a total of 160 acres. Other crops are: potatoes,(16 acres),brassicas (10 acres) and stick beans,(1/2 acre).
